text: XXXII .
text_tokenized: XXXII .

text: Elizabeth was sitting by herself the next morning , and writing to Jane , while Mrs. Collins and Maria were gone on business into the village , when she was startled by a ring at the door , the certain signal of a visitor .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth was sitting by herself the next morning , and writing to Jane , while Mrs. Collins and Maria were gone on business into the village , when she was startled by a ring at the door , the certain signal of a visitor .

text: As she had heard no carriage , she thought it not unlikely to be Lady Catherine ; and under that apprehension was putting away her half - finished letter , that she might escape all impertinent questions , when the door opened , and to her very great surprise Mr. Darcy , and Mr. Darcy only , entered the room . He seemed astonished too on finding her alone , and apologized for his intrusion , by letting her know that he had understood all the ladies to be within .
text_tokenized: As she had heard no carriage , she thought it not unlikely to be Lady Catherine ; and under that apprehension was putting away her half - finished letter , that she might escape all impertinent questions , when the door opened , and to her very great surprise Mr. Darcy , and Mr. Darcy only , entered the room . He seemed astonished too on finding her alone , and apologized for his intrusion , by letting her know that he had understood all the ladies to be within .

text: They then sat down , and when her inquiries after Rosings were made , seemed in danger of sinking into total silence .
text_tokenized: They then sat down , and when her inquiries after Rosings were made , seemed in danger of sinking into total silence .

text: It was absolutely necessary , therefore , to think of something ; and in this emergency recollecting _ when _ she had seen him last in Hertfordshire , and feeling curious to know what he would say on the subject of their hasty departure , she observed,-- “ How very suddenly you all quitted Netherfield last November , Mr. Darcy ! It must have been a most agreeable surprise to Mr. Bingley to see you all after him so soon ; for , if I recollect right , he went but the day before .
text_tokenized: It was absolutely necessary , therefore , to think of something ; and in this emergency recollecting _ when _ she had seen him last in Hertfordshire , and feeling curious to know what he would say on the subject of their hasty departure , she observed,-- “ How very suddenly you all quitted Netherfield last November , Mr. Darcy ! It must have been a most agreeable surprise to Mr. Bingley to see you all after him so soon ; for , if I recollect right , he went but the day before .

text: He and his sisters were well , I hope , when you left London ? ”
text_tokenized: He and his sisters were well , I hope , when you left London ? ”

text: “ Perfectly so , I thank you . ”
text_tokenized: “ Perfectly so , I thank you . ”

text: She found that she was to receive no other answer ; and , after a short pause , added,-- “ I think I have understood that Mr. Bingley has not much idea of ever returning to Netherfield again ? ”
text_tokenized: She found that she was to receive no other answer ; and , after a short pause , added,-- “ I think I have understood that Mr. Bingley has not much idea of ever returning to Netherfield again ? ”

text: “ I have never heard him say so ; but it is probable that he may spend very little of his time there in future .
text_tokenized: “ I have never heard him say so ; but it is probable that he may spend very little of his time there in future .

text: He has many friends , and he is at a time of life when friends and engagements are continually increasing . ”
text_tokenized: He has many friends , and he is at a time of life when friends and engagements are continually increasing . ”

text: “ If he means to be but little at Netherfield , it would be better for the neighbourhood that he should give up the place entirely , for then we might possibly get a settled family there .
text_tokenized: “ If he means to be but little at Netherfield , it would be better for the neighbourhood that he should give up the place entirely , for then we might possibly get a settled family there .

text: But , perhaps , Mr. Bingley did not take the house so much for the convenience of the neighbourhood as for his own , and we must expect him to keep or quit it on the same principle .
text_tokenized: But , perhaps , Mr. Bingley did not take the house so much for the convenience of the neighbourhood as for his own , and we must expect him to keep or quit it on the same principle .

text: ” “ I should not be surprised , ” said Darcy , “ if he were to give it up as soon as any eligible purchase offers . ”
text_tokenized: ” “ I should not be surprised , ” said Darcy , “ if he were to give it up as soon as any eligible purchase offers . ”

text: Elizabeth made no answer .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth made no answer .

text: She was afraid of talking longer of his friend ; and , having nothing else to say , was now determined to leave the trouble of finding a subject to him .
text_tokenized: She was afraid of talking longer of his friend ; and , having nothing else to say , was now determined to leave the trouble of finding a subject to him .

text: He took the hint and soon began with , “ This seems a very comfortable house .
text_tokenized: He took the hint and soon began with , “ This seems a very comfortable house .

text: Lady Catherine , I believe , did a great deal to it when Mr. Collins first came to Hunsford . ”
text_tokenized: Lady Catherine , I believe , did a great deal to it when Mr. Collins first came to Hunsford . ”

text: “ I believe she did -- and I am sure she could not have bestowed her kindness on a more grateful object . ”
text_tokenized: “ I believe she did -- and I am sure she could not have bestowed her kindness on a more grateful object . ”

text: “ Mr. Collins appears very fortunate in his choice of a wife . ” “ Yes , indeed ; his friends may well rejoice in his having met with one of the very few sensible women who would have accepted him , or have made him happy if they had .
text_tokenized: “ Mr. Collins appears very fortunate in his choice of a wife . ” “ Yes , indeed ; his friends may well rejoice in his having met with one of the very few sensible women who would have accepted him , or have made him happy if they had .

text_tokenized: My friend has an excellent understanding -- though I am not certain that I consider her marrying Mr. Collins as the wisest thing

text: She seems perfectly happy , however ; and , in a prudential light , it is certainly a very good match for her .
text_tokenized: She seems perfectly happy , however ; and , in a prudential light , it is certainly a very good match for her .

text: “ It must be very agreeable to her to be settled within so easy a distance of her own family and friends . ” “ An easy distance do you call it ?
text_tokenized: “ It must be very agreeable to her to be settled within so easy a distance of her own family and friends . ” “ An easy distance do you call it ?

text: It is nearly fifty miles . ”
text_tokenized: It is nearly fifty miles . ”

text: “ And what is fifty miles of good road ?
text_tokenized: “ And what is fifty miles of good road ?

text: Little more than half a day ’s journey .
text_tokenized: Little more than half a day ’s journey .

text: Yes , I call it a very easy distance . ”
text_tokenized: Yes , I call it a very easy distance . ”

text: “ I should never have considered the distance as one of the _ advantages _ of the match , ” cried Elizabeth .
text_tokenized: “ I should never have considered the distance as one of the _ advantages _ of the match , ” cried Elizabeth .

text: “ I should never have said Mrs. Collins was settled _ near _ her family . ”
text_tokenized: “ I should never have said Mrs. Collins was settled _ near _ her family . ”

text: “ It is a proof of your own attachment to Hertfordshire .
text_tokenized: “ It is a proof of your own attachment to Hertfordshire .

text: Anything beyond the very neighbourhood of Longbourn , I suppose , would appear far . ” As he spoke there was a sort of smile , which Elizabeth fancied she understood ; he must be supposing her to be thinking of Jane and Netherfield , and she blushed as she answered,-- “ I do not mean to say that a woman may not be settled too near her family .
text_tokenized: Anything beyond the very neighbourhood of Longbourn , I suppose , would appear far . ” As he spoke there was a sort of smile , which Elizabeth fancied she understood ; he must be supposing her to be thinking of Jane and Netherfield , and she blushed as she answered,-- “ I do not mean to say that a woman may not be settled too near her family .

text: The far and the near must be relative , and depend on many varying circumstances .
text_tokenized: The far and the near must be relative , and depend on many varying circumstances .

text: Where there is fortune to make the expense of travelling unimportant , distance becomes no evil .
text_tokenized: Where there is fortune to make the expense of travelling unimportant , distance becomes no evil .

text: But that is not the case _ here _ .
text_tokenized: But that is not the case _ here _ .

text: Mr. and Mrs. Collins have a comfortable income , but not such a one as will allow of frequent journeys -- and I am persuaded my friend would not call herself _ near _ her family under less than _ half _ the present distance . ”
text_tokenized: Mr. and Mrs. Collins have a comfortable income , but not such a one as will allow of frequent journeys -- and I am persuaded my friend would not call herself _ near _ her family under less than _ half _ the present distance . ”

text: Mr. Darcy drew his chair a little towards her , and said , “ _ You _ can not have a right to such very strong local attachment .
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy drew his chair a little towards her , and said , “ _ You _ can not have a right to such very strong local attachment .

text: _ You _ can not have been always at Longbourn . ”
text_tokenized: _ You _ can not have been always at Longbourn . ”

text: Elizabeth looked surprised .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth looked surprised .

text: The gentleman experienced some change of feeling ; he drew back his chair , took a newspaper from the table , and , glancing over it , said , in a colder voice,-- “ Are you pleased with Kent ?
text_tokenized: The gentleman experienced some change of feeling ; he drew back his chair , took a newspaper from the table , and , glancing over it , said , in a colder voice,-- “ Are you pleased with Kent ?

text: ” A short dialogue on the subject of the country ensued , on either side calm and concise -- and soon put an end to by the entrance of Charlotte and her sister , just returned from their walk .

text: Mr. Darcy related the mistake which had occasioned his intruding on Miss Bennet , and , after sitting a few minutes longer , without saying much to anybody , went away .
text_tokenized: Mr. Darcy related the mistake which had occasioned his intruding on Miss Bennet , and , after sitting a few minutes longer , without saying much to anybody , went away .

text_tokenized: “ What can be the meaning of this ? ” said Charlotte , as soon as he was gone .

text: “ My dear Eliza , he must be in love with you , or he would never have called on us in this familiar way .
text_tokenized: “ My dear Eliza , he must be in love with you , or he would never have called on us in this familiar way .

text: But when Elizabeth told of his silence , it did not seem very likely , even to Charlotte ’s wishes , to be the case ; and , after various conjectures , they could at last only suppose his visit to proceed from the difficulty of finding anything to do , which was the more probable from the time of year .

text: But why Mr. Darcy came so often to the Parsonage it was more difficult to understand .
text_tokenized: But why Mr. Darcy came so often to the Parsonage it was more difficult to understand .

text: It could not be for society , as he frequently sat there ten minutes together without opening his lips ; and when he did speak , it seemed the effect of necessity rather than of choice -- a sacrifice to propriety , not a pleasure to himself .
text_tokenized: It could not be for society , as he frequently sat there ten minutes together without opening his lips ; and when he did speak , it seemed the effect of necessity rather than of choice -- a sacrifice to propriety , not a pleasure to himself .

text: He seldom appeared really animated .
text_tokenized: He seldom appeared really animated .

text: Mrs. Collins knew not what to make of him .
text_tokenized: Mrs. Collins knew not what to make of him .

text: Colonel Fitzwilliam ’s occasionally laughing at his stupidity proved that he was generally different , which her own knowledge of him could not have told her ; and as she would have liked to believe this change the effect of love , and the object of that love her friend Eliza , she set herself seriously to work to find it out : she watched him whenever they were at Rosings , and whenever he came to Hunsford ; but without much success .

text: doubted whether there were much admiration in it , and sometimes it seemed nothing but absence of mind . She had once or twice suggested to Elizabeth the possibility of his being partial to her , but Elizabeth always laughed at the idea ; and Mrs. Collins did not think it right to press the subject , from the danger of raising expectations which might only end in disappointment ; for in her opinion it admitted not of a doubt , that all her friend ’s dislike would vanish , if she could suppose him to be in her power . In her kind schemes for Elizabeth , she sometimes planned her marrying Colonel Fitzwilliam .

In her kind schemes for Elizabeth , she sometimes planned her marrying Colonel Fitzwilliam .

text: He was , beyond comparison , the pleasantest man : he certainly admired her , and his situation in life was most eligible ; but , to counterbalance these advantages , Mr. Darcy had considerable patronage in the church , and his cousin could have none at all .

text: XXXIII .
text_tokenized: XXXIII .

text: More than once did Elizabeth , in her ramble within the park , unexpectedly meet Mr. Darcy .
text_tokenized: More than once did Elizabeth , in her ramble within the park , unexpectedly meet Mr. Darcy .

text: She felt all the perverseness of the mischance that should bring him where no one else was brought ; and , to prevent its ever happening again , took care to inform him , at first , that it was a favourite haunt of hers .
text_tokenized: She felt all the perverseness of the mischance that should bring him where no one else was brought ; and , to prevent its ever happening again , took care to inform him , at first , that it was a favourite haunt of hers .

text: How it could occur a second time , therefore , was very odd !
text_tokenized: How it could occur a second time , therefore , was very odd !

text: Yet it did , and even the third .
text_tokenized: Yet it did , and even the third .

text: It seemed like wilful ill - nature , or a voluntary penance ; for on these occasions it was not merely a few formal inquiries and an awkward pause and then away , but he actually thought it necessary to turn back and walk with her .
text_tokenized: It seemed like wilful ill - nature , or a voluntary penance ; for on these occasions it was not merely a few formal inquiries and an awkward pause and then away , but he actually thought it necessary to turn back and walk with her .

text: He never said a great deal , nor did she give herself the trouble of talking or of listening much ; but it struck her in the course of their third encounter that he was asking some odd unconnected questions -- about her pleasure in being at Hunsford , her love of solitary walks , and her opinion of Mr. and Mrs. Collins ’s happiness ; and that in speaking of Rosings , and her not perfectly understanding the house , he seemed to expect that whenever she came into Kent again she would be staying _ there _ too .
text_tokenized: He never said a great deal , nor did she give herself the trouble of talking or of listening much ; but it struck her in the course of their third encounter that he was asking some odd unconnected questions -- about her pleasure in being at Hunsford , her love of solitary walks , and her opinion of Mr. and Mrs. Collins ’s happiness ; and that in speaking of Rosings , and her not perfectly understanding the house , he seemed to expect that whenever she came into Kent again she would be staying _ there _ too .

text: His words seemed to imply it .
text_tokenized: His words seemed to imply it .

text: Could he have Colonel Fitzwilliam in his thoughts ?
text_tokenized: Could he have Colonel Fitzwilliam in his thoughts ?

text: She supposed , if he meant anything , he must mean an allusion to what might arise in that quarter .
text_tokenized: She supposed , if he meant anything , he must mean an allusion to what might arise in that quarter .

text: It distressed her a little , and she was quite glad to find herself at the gate in the pales opposite the Parsonage .
text_tokenized: It distressed her a little , and she was quite glad to find herself at the gate in the pales opposite the Parsonage .

text: She was engaged one day , as she walked , in re - perusing Jane ’s last letter , and dwelling on some passages which proved that Jane had not written in spirits , when , instead of being again surprised by Mr. Darcy , she saw , on looking up , that Colonel Fitzwilliam was meeting her .
text_tokenized: She was engaged one day , as she walked , in re - perusing Jane ’s last letter , and dwelling on some passages which proved that Jane had not written in spirits , when , instead of being again surprised by Mr. Darcy , she saw , on looking up , that Colonel Fitzwilliam was meeting her .

text: Putting away the letter immediately , and forcing a smile , she said,-- “ I did not know before that you ever walked this way . ”
text_tokenized: Putting away the letter immediately , and forcing a smile , she said,-- “ I did not know before that you ever walked this way . ”

text: “ I have been making the tour of the park , ” he replied , “ as I generally do every year , and intended to close it with a call at the Parsonage .
text_tokenized: “ I have been making the tour of the park , ” he replied , “ as I generally do every year , and intended to close it with a call at the Parsonage .

text: Are you going much farther ? ”
text_tokenized: Are you going much farther ? ”

text: “ No , I should have turned in a moment . ” And accordingly she did turn , and they walked towards the Parsonage together .
text_tokenized: “ No , I should have turned in a moment . ” And accordingly she did turn , and they walked towards the Parsonage together .

text: “ Do you certainly leave Kent on Saturday ? ” said she .
text_tokenized: “ Do you certainly leave Kent on Saturday ? ” said she .

text: “ Yes -- if Darcy does not put it off again .
text_tokenized: “ Yes -- if Darcy does not put it off again .

text: But I am at his disposal .
text_tokenized: But I am at his disposal .

text: He arranges the business just as he pleases . ”
text_tokenized: He arranges the business just as he pleases . ”

text: “ And if not able to please himself in the arrangement , he has at least great pleasure in the power of choice .
text_tokenized: “ And if not able to please himself in the arrangement , he has at least great pleasure in the power of choice .

text: I do not know anybody who seems more to enjoy the power of doing what he likes than Mr. Darcy .
text_tokenized: I do not know anybody who seems more to enjoy the power of doing what he likes than Mr. Darcy .

text: “ He likes to have his own way very well , ” replied Colonel Fitzwilliam .
text_tokenized: “ He likes to have his own way very well , ” replied Colonel Fitzwilliam .

text: “ But so we all do .
text_tokenized: “ But so we all do .

text: It is only that he has better means of having it than many others , because he is rich , and many others are poor .
text_tokenized: It is only that he has better means of having it than many others , because he is rich , and many others are poor .

text: I speak feelingly .
text_tokenized: I speak feelingly .

text: A younger son , you know , must be inured to self - denial and dependence . ”
text_tokenized: A younger son , you know , must be inured to self - denial and dependence . ”

text: “ In my opinion , the younger son of an earl can know very little of either .
text_tokenized: “ In my opinion , the younger son of an earl can know very little of either .

text: Now , seriously , what have you ever known of self - denial and dependence ?
text_tokenized: Now , seriously , what have you ever known of self - denial and dependence ?

text: When have you been prevented by want of money from going wherever you chose or procuring anything you had a fancy for ? ”
text_tokenized: When have you been prevented by want of money from going wherever you chose or procuring anything you had a fancy for ? ”

text: “ These are home questions -- and perhaps I can not say that I have experienced many hardships of that nature .
text_tokenized: “ These are home questions -- and perhaps I can not say that I have experienced many hardships of that nature .

text: But in matters of greater weight , I may suffer from the want of money .
text_tokenized: But in matters of greater weight , I may suffer from the want of money .

text: Younger sons can not marry where they like . ” “ Unless where they like women of fortune , which I think they very often do . ”
text_tokenized: Younger sons can not marry where they like . ” “ Unless where they like women of fortune , which I think they very often do . ”

text: “ Our habits of expense make us too dependent , and there are not many in my rank of life who can afford to marry without some attention to money . ”
text_tokenized: “ Our habits of expense make us too dependent , and there are not many in my rank of life who can afford to marry without some attention to money . ”

text: “ Is this , ” thought Elizabeth , “ meant for me ? ” and she coloured at the idea ; but , recovering herself , said in a lively tone , “ And pray , what is the usual price of an earl ’s younger son ?
text_tokenized: “ Is this , ” thought Elizabeth , “ meant for me ? ” and she coloured at the idea ; but , recovering herself , said in a lively tone , “ And pray , what is the usual price of an earl ’s younger son ?

text: Unless the elder brother is very sickly , I suppose you would not ask above fifty thousand pounds . ”
text_tokenized: Unless the elder brother is very sickly , I suppose you would not ask above fifty thousand pounds . ”

text: He answered her in the same style , and the subject dropped .
text_tokenized: He answered her in the same style , and the subject dropped .

text: To interrupt a silence which might make him fancy her affected with what had passed , she soon afterwards said,-- “ I imagine your cousin brought you down with him chiefly for the sake of having somebody at his disposal .
text_tokenized: To interrupt a silence which might make him fancy her affected with what had passed , she soon afterwards said,-- “ I imagine your cousin brought you down with him chiefly for the sake of having somebody at his disposal .

text_tokenized: I wonder he does not marry , to secure a lasting convenience of that kind .

text_tokenized: But , perhaps , his sister does as well for the present ; and , as she is under his sole care , he may do what he likes with her . ”

text: I am joined with him in the guardianship of Miss Darcy . ” “ Are you , indeed ?
text_tokenized: I am joined with him in the guardianship of Miss Darcy . ” “ Are you , indeed ?

text_tokenized: And pray what sort of a guardian do you make ?

text_tokenized: Does your charge give you much trouble ?

text: Young ladies of her age are sometimes a little difficult to manage ; and if she has the true Darcy spirit , she may like to have her own way . ” As she spoke , she observed him looking at her earnestly ; and the manner in which he immediately asked her why she supposed Miss Darcy likely to give them any uneasiness , convinced her that she had somehow or other got pretty near the truth .

text_tokenized: “ You need not be frightened .

text_tokenized: Their brother is a pleasant , gentlemanlike man -- he is a great friend of Darcy ’s . ”

text: “ Oh yes , ” said Elizabeth drily--“Mr . Darcy is uncommonly kind to Mr. Bingley , and takes a prodigious deal of care of him . ”
text_tokenized: “ Oh yes , ” said Elizabeth drily--“Mr . Darcy is uncommonly kind to Mr. Bingley , and takes a prodigious deal of care of him . ”

text_tokenized: “ Care of him !

text: Yes , I really believe Darcy _ does _ take care of him in those points where he most wants care .
text_tokenized: Yes , I really believe Darcy _ does _ take care of him in those points where he most wants care .

text: “ It is a circumstance which Darcy of course could not wish to be generally known , because if it were to get round to the lady ’s family it would be an unpleasant thing . ” “ You may depend upon my not mentioning it . ” “ And remember that I have not much reason for supposing it to be Bingley .
text_tokenized: “ It is a circumstance which Darcy of course could not wish to be generally known , because if it were to get round to the lady ’s family it would be an unpleasant thing . ” “ You may depend upon my not mentioning it . ” “ And remember that I have not much reason for supposing it to be Bingley .

text: What he told me was merely this : that he congratulated himself on having lately saved a friend from the inconveniences of a most imprudent marriage , but without mentioning names or any other particulars ; and I only suspected it to be Bingley from believing him the kind of young man to get into a scrape of that sort , and from knowing them to have been together the whole of last summer .
text_tokenized: What he told me was merely this : that he congratulated himself on having lately saved a friend from the inconveniences of a most imprudent marriage , but without mentioning names or any other particulars ; and I only suspected it to be Bingley from believing him the kind of young man to get into a scrape of that sort , and from knowing them to have been together the whole of last summer .

text: “ Did Mr. Darcy give you his reasons for this interference ?
text_tokenized: “ Did Mr. Darcy give you his reasons for this interference ?

text: “ I understood that there were some very strong objections against the lady . ” “ And what arts did he use to separate them ? ” “ He did not talk to me of his own arts , ” said Fitzwilliam , smiling .
text_tokenized: “ I understood that there were some very strong objections against the lady . ” “ And what arts did he use to separate them ? ” “ He did not talk to me of his own arts , ” said Fitzwilliam , smiling .

text: “ He only told me what I have now told you . ”
text_tokenized: “ He only told me what I have now told you . ”

text: Elizabeth made no answer , and walked on , her heart swelling with indignation .
text_tokenized: Elizabeth made no answer , and walked on , her heart swelling with indignation .

text: After watching her a little , Fitzwilliam asked her why she was so thoughtful .
text_tokenized: After watching her a little , Fitzwilliam asked her why she was so thoughtful .

text: “ I am thinking of what you have been telling me , ” said she .
text_tokenized: “ I am thinking of what you have been telling me , ” said she .

text: “ Your cousin ’s conduct does not suit my feelings .
text_tokenized: “ Your cousin ’s conduct does not suit my feelings .

text: Why was he to be the judge ? ”
text_tokenized: Why was he to be the judge ? ”

text: “ You are rather disposed to call his interference officious ? ”
text_tokenized: “ You are rather disposed to call his interference officious ? ”

text: “ I do not see what right Mr. Darcy had to decide on the propriety of his friend ’s inclination ; or why , upon his own judgment alone , he was to determine and direct in what manner that friend was to be happy .
text_tokenized: “ I do not see what right Mr. Darcy had to decide on the propriety of his friend ’s inclination ; or why , upon his own judgment alone , he was to determine and direct in what manner that friend was to be happy .

text: But , ” she continued , recollecting herself , “ as we know none of the particulars , it is not fair to condemn him .
text_tokenized: But , ” she continued , recollecting herself , “ as we know none of the particulars , it is not fair to condemn him .

text: It is not to be supposed that there was much affection in the case . ”
text_tokenized: It is not to be supposed that there was much affection in the case . ”

text: “ That is not an unnatural surmise , ” said Fitzwilliam ; “ but it is lessening the honour of my cousin ’s triumph very sadly
text_tokenized: “ That is not an unnatural surmise , ” said Fitzwilliam ; “ but it is lessening the honour of my cousin ’s triumph very sadly

text: This was spoken jestingly , but it appeared to her so just a picture of Mr. Darcy , that she would not trust herself with an answer ; and , therefore , abruptly changing the conversation , talked on indifferent matters till they reached the Parsonage .
text_tokenized: This was spoken jestingly , but it appeared to her so just a picture of Mr. Darcy , that she would not trust herself with an answer ; and , therefore , abruptly changing the conversation , talked on indifferent matters till they reached the Parsonage .

text: There , shut into her own room , as soon as their visitor left them , she could think without interruption of all that she had heard .
text_tokenized: There , shut into her own room , as soon as their visitor left them , she could think without interruption of all that she had heard .

text: It was not to be supposed that any other people could be meant than those with whom she was connected .
text_tokenized: It was not to be supposed that any other people could be meant than those with whom she was connected .

text: There could not exist in the world _ two _ men over whom Mr. Darcy could have such boundless influence .
text_tokenized: There could not exist in the world _ two _ men over whom Mr. Darcy could have such boundless influence .

text: That he had been concerned in the measures taken to separate Mr. Bingley and Jane , she had never doubted ; but she had always attributed to Miss Bingley the principal design and arrangement of them .
text_tokenized: That he had been concerned in the measures taken to separate Mr. Bingley and Jane , she had never doubted ; but she had always attributed to Miss Bingley the principal design and arrangement of them .

text: If his own vanity , however , did not mislead him , _ he _ was the cause -- his pride and caprice were the cause -- of all that Jane had suffered , and still continued to suffer .
text_tokenized: If his own vanity , however , did not mislead him , _ he _ was the cause -- his pride and caprice were the cause -- of all that Jane had suffered , and still continued to suffer .

text: He had ruined for a while every hope of happiness for the most affectionate , generous heart in the world ; and no one could say how lasting an evil he might have inflicted .
text_tokenized: He had ruined for a while every hope of happiness for the most affectionate , generous heart in the world ; and no one could say how lasting an evil he might have inflicted .

text: “ There were some very strong objections against the lady , ” were Colonel Fitzwilliam ’s words ; and these strong objections probably were , her having one uncle who was a country attorney , and another who was in business in London .
text_tokenized: “ There were some very strong objections against the lady , ” were Colonel Fitzwilliam ’s words ; and these strong objections probably were , her having one uncle who was a country attorney , and another who was in business in London .

text: “ To Jane herself , ” she exclaimed , “ there could be no possibility of objection,--all loveliness and goodness as she is !
text_tokenized: “ To Jane herself , ” she exclaimed , “ there could be no possibility of objection,--all loveliness and goodness as she is !

text: Her understanding excellent , her mind improved , and her manners captivating .
text_tokenized: Her understanding excellent , her mind improved , and her manners captivating .

text: Neither could anything be urged against my father , who , though with some peculiarities , has abilities which Mr. Darcy himself need not disdain , and respectability which he will probably never reach . ”
text_tokenized: Neither could anything be urged against my father , who , though with some peculiarities , has abilities which Mr. Darcy himself need not disdain , and respectability which he will probably never reach . ”

text: When she thought of her mother , indeed , her confidence gave way a little ; but she would not allow that any objections _ there _ had material weight with Mr. Darcy , whose pride , she was convinced , would receive a deeper wound from the want of importance in his friend ’s connections than from their want of sense ; and she was quite decided , at last , that he had been partly governed by this worst kind of pride , and partly by the wish of retaining Mr. Bingley for his sister .
text_tokenized: When she thought of her mother , indeed , her confidence gave way a little ; but she would not allow that any objections _ there _ had material weight with Mr. Darcy , whose pride , she was convinced , would receive a deeper wound from the want of importance in his friend ’s connections than from their want of sense ; and she was quite decided , at last , that he had been partly governed by this worst kind of pride , and partly by the wish of retaining Mr. Bingley for his sister .

text: The agitation and tears which the subject occasioned brought on a headache ; and it grew so much worse towards the evening that , added to her unwillingness to see Mr. Darcy , it determined her not to attend her cousins to Rosings , where they were engaged to drink tea .

text: Mrs. Collins ,
text_tokenized: Mrs. Collins ,

text: seeing that she was really unwell , did not press her to go , and as much as possible prevented her husband from pressing her ; but Mr. Collins could not conceal his apprehension of Lady Catherine ’s being rather displeased by her staying at home .
